title: Tenant–Landlord Agreement
content:
1. Parties Involved

This agreement is made between:

- Landlord (Rentee): The legal owner or authorized manager of the property.
- Tenant (Renter): The individual renting and occupying the property.
- Both parties agree to abide by the terms outlined below.

2. Property & Lease Details

- The property address, unit number, rent amount, and duration of stay must be stated clearly in the digital  contract.
- The tenant may occupy the property only for residential purposes unless otherwise agreed in writing.
- Subletting, unauthorized sharing, or commercial use is strictly prohibited without prior consent from the landlord.

3. Rent, Payments & Receipts

- The tenant shall pay the monthly rent by the due date specified in the contract.
- Accepted payment modes include bank transfer, mobile financial services (MFS), or any digital payment method approved in the system.
- Every successful payment will automatically generate a digital receipt stored in the system.
- Late payments may incur penalties as stated in the specific property agreement.

4. Security Deposit

- The tenant shall pay a security deposit (amount specified in the contract) before occupancy.
- The deposit is refundable at the end of the lease period after deducting unpaid dues or damage costs.
- The landlord must provide a breakdown of any deductions.

5. Responsibilities of the Tenant

The tenant agrees to:

- Maintain the property in clean and good condition.
- Avoid causing damage, nuisance, or disturbance to neighbors.
- Comply with building rules, safety guidelines, and legal requirements in Bangladesh.
- Allow the landlord reasonable access for repairs or inspections with prior notice.
- Inform the landlord of maintenance issues promptly.

6. Responsibilities of the Landlord

The landlord agrees to:

- Ensure the property is in livable condition at the start of the tenancy.
- Conduct repairs for essential utilities (water, electricity, structural issues) within a reasonable period.
- Not increase rent arbitrarily or without prior written notice as per local norms.
- Provide official receipts for all financial transactions (generated automatically by the platform).
- Respect the privacy of the tenant and provide reasonable notice before entering the property.

7. Utility Bills & Service Charges

- Unless stated otherwise, tenants are responsible for paying electricity, gas, water, and internet bills.
- Any shared service charge (e.g., building maintenance, security) must be defined clearly in the lease.

8. Damage, Repairs & Maintenance

- Tenants must cover costs of damages caused by negligence or misuse.
- Landlords remain responsible for structural and major repairs.
- Any modification or renovation by the tenant requires written approval.

9. Termination & Move-Out Conditions

- Either party may terminate the contract by providing the notice period specified in the lease (commonly 30 days).
- The tenant must hand over the property in good condition.
- All keys/access credentials must be returned at move-out.
- Final utility bills must be cleared before deposit refund.

10. Dispute Resolution

- All disagreements should first be addressed through direct communication between the landlord and tenant.
- If unresolved, disputes may be escalated through:

    a. Mediation via platform support, or
    b. Relevant legal authorities under Bangladeshi law.

11. Compliance with Bangladeshi Laws

- This agreement is governed by the laws of the People’s Republic of Bangladesh, including applicable municipal regulations related to rental housing.

12. Digital Acceptance

- By submitting, accepting, or signing the digital contract within the system, both parties acknowledge that:
- The agreement is legally valid under electronic transactions rules in Bangladesh.
- All records stored in the system serve as official documentation for verification, dispute resolution, and institutional access (e.g., banks, regulators).
